intro: Helichrysum italicum subsp. microphyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, golden-yellow flower heads that are tightly packed and resemble tiny suns, giving it its common name. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its aromatic properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its essential oils are valued in aromatherapy and traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities.
